1.text: Combine milk, sugar, and vanilla in a medium bowl.

2.text: Add the mixture to an ice cream maker.

3.text: Pour it in a shallow dish if you don’t have an ice cream maker.

4.text: Stir the mixture every 2 to 4 hours.

5.text: Freeze the mixture for 8 hours or overnight.

6.text: Top with your favorite toppings and serve.

7.text: Put the sweetened condensed milk in the refrigerator.

8.text: Use a stand mixer to beat the heavy cream.

9.text: Turn the speed to low and add the condensed milk and vanilla.

10.text: Turn the speed back up to medium.

11.text: Customize your ice cream with your favorite add-ins (optional).

12.text: Scoop the mixture into a container and freeze it for 6 hours.

13.text: Pour coconut milk into a saucepan.

14.text: Add the sweetener of your choice and salt.

15.text: Stir the coconut milk over medium-low heat for 1-2 minutes.

16.text: Combine cornstarch and the reserved coconut milk.

17.text: Pour the cornstarch mixture into the warm coconut milk.

18.text: Turn the heat up to medium and cook for 6-8 minutes.

19.text: Remove from heat and add vanilla.

20.text: Pour the base into a container and refrigerate it.

21.text: Churn the chilled base for 10-20 minutes.

22.text: Transfer your ice cream to a container and freeze for 4 hours.
